results.title: The Greening
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn and Cradle Mountain Film Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the setting up of the instant lawn for the Swanston Street summer party which was held as part of Victoria’s 150th anniversary celebrations.

results.title: The Green plant
results.brief_description: Aspects of all forms of plant life; their fundamental functions (respiration, intake of food and outlet of waste matter, irritability etc.) Exist here as in the higher forms of life. The basic construction of a plant is described; the way it feeds and grows.

results.title: The Greedy frog
results.creator_credit: Murray Lomax, Kate White, Kate White Productions and South Australian Government (Film and Television Financing Fund)
results.brief_description: This aboriginal dreamtime story of The Greedy Frog is told using footage of Australian animals in the wild. Suitable for children the story tells of The Greedy Frog who drank all the water in the billabong leaving the plants and all the animals in the area without water. The koala wants to fix the situation and decides the solution is to make the frog laugh. After enlisting the help of all the other animals it is the Old Man Emu that finally saves the day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Lomax, Kate White, Kate White Productions and South Australian Government (Film and Television Financing Fund)

results.title: The Greatest run on earth
results.creator_credit: Sam Pillsbury, Pillsbury Films and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Why does an entire city suddenly go crazy on running? In the land where jogging was ‘invented’ by Arthur Lydiard twenty years ago, a film crew looked closely at how the city of Auckland, population a mere 500,000 is convulsed by preparations for this bizarre annual event, ‘the greatest run on earth’.

results.title: The Great Train Robbery
results.brief_description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. Of over 250 films created by Porter, his most important include Jack and the Beanstalk (1902), Life of an American Fireman (1903), The Great Train Robbery (1903), The Kleptomaniac (1905), Life of a Cowboy (1906), Rescued from an Eagle’s Nest (1908), and The Prisoner of Zenda (1913) .
results.description: Edwin Stanton Porter (April 21, 1870 – April 30, 1941) was an American film pioneer, most famous as a producer, director, studio manager and cinematographer with the Edison Manufacturing Company and the Famous Players Film Company. results.title: The Great health robbery
results.brief_description: Infant mortality caused by misuse of powdered milk is growing in many Third World countries, despite widespread awareness of the dangers. Outlines the problems in Yemen, and criticises the marketing of powdered milk, which many mothers use in order to appear progressive and Western.

results.title: The Great chase [silent]
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: W. C. Fields earns himself a jot at the bank as a security guard after unwittingly foiling the getaway of bank robbers. Unfortunately he is then taken hostage by one of the robbers in another robbery attempt at the bank and forced to drive the getaway cark, with policemen hot on their tail. Possibly from the feature “The Bank dick” (also known as “The Bank detective), 1940.

results.title: The Great Chase
results.brief_description: Here is a cavalcade of the most hair-raising pursuits in film from the silent era: features sequences from “The Great Train Robbery” by pioneer Edwin S Porter; D.W.Griffith’s “Way Down East” with Lillian Gish; “The Mark of Zorro” starring Douglas Fairbanks Snr; Buster Keaton’s “The General” and many others. It is an exciting, funny and classic treat for young and old alike about the silent era. Rated: G

results.title: The Great Camel Race
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia) and Orana Films
results.brief_description: The Great Camel Race, the longest animal endurance ever - from Alice Springs to the Gold Coast - is a rare example of the outback documentary that has a real story to tell. A story in which we can cheer the heroes and choose our villains!
